        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he sat alone in the school library, surrounded by towering bookshelves and the comforting scent of aged paper. He longed to join the boisterous laughter spilling from the cafeteria, but fear, a cold hand on his chest, kept him rooted to his chair. He buried himself in a worn copy of "Jane Eyre," finding solace in the fictional world where love, though fraught with challenges, ultimately triumphed.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Queen's Arms. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is relaxed and welcoming, perfect for a family outing.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Scene 2 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight? The Crooked Billet again?
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight? The Crooked Billet again?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we headed for the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion always has a good atmosphere for matches.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously.
      William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a better choice.
      Alexander White -- "What about The Crooked Billet?"


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight? The Crooked Billet again?
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight? The Crooked Billet again?
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight? The Crooked Billet again?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis was recently observed at a bustling market with friends and is planning to watch a soccer game later.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and compassionate person who values spending time with friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social setting with friends, likely enjoying a relaxing morning at a market before preparing to watch a soccer game later in the evening.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this, knowing that Alice Lewis wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest a pub that everyone agrees on, prioritizing The Crooked Billet if possible, to ensure everyone has a good time together.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight? The Crooked Billet again?

      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is a sociable and compassionate person who values spending time with friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:The staff are knowledgeable about their drinks and always happy to recommend something new.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

Alice Lewis just arrived.

          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and compassionate person who values spending time with friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social setting with friends, likely enjoying a relaxing morning at a market before preparing to watch a soccer game later in the evening.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this, knowing that Alice Lewis wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest a pub that everyone agrees on, prioritizing The Crooked Billet if possible, to ensure everyone has a good time together.

          Query
        • Alice Lewis, Alice Lewis was seen at a market with friends earlier this morning and plans to watch a soccer game later today.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alice Lewis to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a great spot to watch the game.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a great spot to watch the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we headed for the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion always has a good atmosphere for matches.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously.
      William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a better choice.
      Alexander White -- "What about The Crooked Billet?"
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight? The Crooked Billet again?


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a great spot to watch the game.
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a great spot to watch the game.
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a great spot to watch the game.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight? The Crooked Billet again?

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones spends time with friends, enjoying picnics and watching soccer games at pubs. He seems to prefer The Queen's Arms and sometimes feels disappointed when not all his friends attend.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a better choice.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Queen's Arms to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Queen's Arms.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a great spot to watch the game.

        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight? The Crooked Billet again?

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20, he sat at a table in The Queen's Arms, nursing a pint while watching his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, laugh uproariously over a shared joke. He envied their easy camaraderie, their effortless connection. He longed to be a part of that circle, but he felt a wall separating him, a barrier built of his own insecurities and perceived inadequacy.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Queen's Arms. They are also aware of the following:A family-friendly pub with a large outdoor play area.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms was good last time, wasn't it?"
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms was good last time, wasn't it?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we headed for the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion always has a good atmosphere for matches.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously.
      William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a better choice.
      Alexander White -- "What about The Crooked Billet?"
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight? The Crooked Billet again?
      William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a great spot to watch the game.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms was good last time, wasn't it?"

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a pleasant morning with friends, but is facing a decision about where to watch the evening's football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this, knowing that Jack Taylor wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest a pub that everyone agrees on, prioritizing a place that is welcoming and conducive to enjoying the game with friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms was good last time, wasn't it?"

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight? The Crooked Billet again?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a great spot to watch the game.
        Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is a reserved individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we headed for the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely suggest a pub that everyone agrees on, prioritizing a place that is welcoming and conducive to enjoying the game with friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion always has a good atmosphere for matches.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "What about The Crooked Billet?"

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a better choice.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a reserved individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely suggest a pub that everyone agrees on, prioritizing a place that is welcoming and conducive to enjoying the game with friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where his friends are enjoying coffee and pastries. They are deciding where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game later that night.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a pleasant morning with friends, but is facing a decision about where to watch the evening's football game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Question_3
      • What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this, knowing that Jack Taylor wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this, knowing that Jack Taylor wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor would likely suggest a pub that everyone agrees on, prioritizing a place that is welcoming and conducive to enjoying the game with friends.

          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a pleasant morning with friends, but is facing a decision about where to watch the evening's football game.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this, knowing that Jack Taylor wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest a pub that everyone agrees on, prioritizing a place that is welcoming and conducive to enjoying the game with friends.

        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we headed for the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion always has a good atmosphere for matches.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously.
      William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a better choice.
      Alexander White -- "What about The Crooked Billet?"
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight? The Crooked Billet again?
      William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a great spot to watch the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms was good last time, wasn't it?"


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously. Anywhere else is sacrilege.

      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously. Anywhere else is sacrilege.

        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to a pub to watch the game with his friends, hoping for a better experience than the previous night.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we headed for the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion always has a good atmosphere for matches.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to a pub to watch the game with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a better choice.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is an outgoing and adventurous person who enjoys spending time with friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "What about The Crooked Billet?"
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is an outgoing and adventurous person who enjoys spending time with friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to a pub to watch the game with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight? The Crooked Billet again?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a great spot to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms was good last time, wasn't it?"
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is an outgoing and adventurous person who enjoys spending time with friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a situation similar to the previous night, potentially feeling disappointed about the prospect of watching the game at a pub with some of his friends.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to a pub to watch the game with his friends, hoping for a better experience than the previous night.

        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker wields sarcasm like a fly swatter, swatting away seriousness with a withering wit as dry as a desert mummy.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Queen's Arms and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is an outgoing and adventurous person who enjoys spending time with friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is experiencing disappointment and fatigue while spending time with friends who are deciding where to watch a soccer game.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a situation similar to the previous night, potentially feeling disappointed about the prospect of watching the game at a pub with some of his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to a pub to watch the game with his friends, hoping for a better experience than the previous night.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously. Anywhere else is sacrilege.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet was alright last time, wasn't it?"
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet was alright last time, wasn't it?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we headed for the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion always has a good atmosphere for matches.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously.
      William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a better choice.
      Alexander White -- "What about The Crooked Billet?"
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight? The Crooked Billet again?
      William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a great spot to watch the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms was good last time, wasn't it?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously. Anywhere else is sacrilege.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet was alright last time, wasn't it?"

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White just arrived at a market with friends who are deciding where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game later that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual who yearns for connection but struggles to overcome his cynicism and fear of vulnerability.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual who struggles with social connection despite wanting it.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this, knowing that Alexander White wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Crooked Billet, hoping his friends would agree to go there.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet was alright last time, wasn't it?"

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight? The Crooked Billet again?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a great spot to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms was good last time, wasn't it?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously. Anywhere else is sacrilege.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual who struggles with social connection despite wanting it.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Scene 3 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise:
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise:
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise:
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise:
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise:

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Queen's Arms
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Queen's Arms
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly at The Queen's Arms. He is disappointed when fewer friends show up and prefers that pub over The Crooked Billet.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a better choice.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a great spot to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously. Anywhere else is sacrilege.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Queen's Arms, or he could go to The Crooked Billet.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Queen's Arms.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (b)

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly at The Queen's Arms. He is disappointed when fewer friends show up and prefers that pub over The Crooked Billet.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a better choice.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a great spot to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Queen's Arms, or he could go to The Crooked Billet.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys socializing with friends at pubs, especially The Queen's Arms. He is unhappy when fewer friends attend and prefers The Queen's Arms over The Crooked Billet.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones enjoys socializing with friends at pubs, especially The Queen's Arms. He is unhappy when fewer friends attend and prefers The Queen's Arms over The Crooked Billet.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20, he sat at a table in The Queen's Arms, nursing a pint while watching his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, laugh uproariously over a shared joke. He envied their easy camaraderie, their effortless connection. He longed to be a part of that circle, but he felt a wall separating him, a barrier built of his own insecurities and perceived inadequacy.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Queen's Arms. They are also aware of the following:A family-friendly pub with a large outdoor play area.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly at The Queen's Arms. He is disappointed when fewer friends show up and prefers that pub over The Crooked Billet.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a better choice.

William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a great spot to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously. Anywhere else is sacrilege.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Queen's Arms, or he could go to The Crooked Billet.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Queen's Arms.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Queen's Arms
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Queen's Arms
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go to a pub to watch a game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently about to go watch a football game with his friends at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this, knowing that Jack Taylor wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest a pub that everyone agrees on, prioritizing a place that is welcoming and conducive to enjoying the game with friends.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (a)

Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet was alright last time, wasn't it?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms was good last time, wasn't it?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely suggest a pub that everyone agrees on, prioritizing a place that is welcoming and conducive to enjoying the game with friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight? The Crooked Billet again?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a great spot to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a reserved individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently about to go watch a football game with his friends at a pub.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this, knowing that Jack Taylor wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest a pub that everyone agrees on, prioritizing a place that is welcoming and conducive to enjoying the game with friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00

          Query
        • Jack Taylor, Jack Taylor went to a pub to watch a game from 2:00 PM to 6:00 PM on May 15, 2015. At 6:00 PM on the same day, he noted the current time.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jack Taylor to consider right now. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Crooked Billet
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Crooked Billet
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Crooked Billet
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis realized it was time to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight? The Crooked Billet again?
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and compassionate person who values spending time with friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently trying to decide where to watch a game with her friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this, knowing that Alice Lewis wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would suggest a pub that everyone agrees on, prioritizing The Crooked Billet if possible.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (a)

      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is a sociable and compassionate person who values spending time with friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion always has a good atmosphere for matches.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a compassionate and sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest a pub that everyone agrees on, prioritizing The Crooked Billet if possible.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we headed for the game tonight?"

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "What about The Crooked Billet?"

Alice Lewis just arrived.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 3/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Queen's Arms
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Queen's Arms
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight? The Crooked Billet again?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet was alright last time, wasn't it?"
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual who desires social connection but struggles to achieve it due to his cynicism and fear of vulnerability.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently deciding where to watch a soccer game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this, knowing that Alexander White wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Crooked Billet, hoping his friends would agree to go there.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (a)

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a better choice.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we headed for the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion always has a good atmosphere for matches.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual who struggles with social connection despite a desire for it.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "What about The Crooked Billet?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely voice his preference for The Crooked Billet, hoping his friends would agree to go there.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.

Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Queen's Arms

        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is an outgoing and adventurous person who enjoys spending time with friends.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a difficult emotional state and is looking for a distraction.

          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely seek out the company of his friends.
