          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker wields sarcasm like a fly swatter, swatting away seriousness with a withering wit as dry as a desert mummy.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Queen's Arms and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is an outgoing and adventurous person who enjoys spending time with friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling emotional pain and loneliness, and is likely fatigued. He is planning to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a difficult emotional state and is looking for a distraction.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely seek out the company of his friends.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Queen's Arms

Always use third-person limited perspective.

Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had the worst time ever.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Scene 4 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, mind if I join you?"
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, mind if I join you?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we headed for the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion always has a good atmosphere for matches.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously.
      William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a better choice.
      Alexander White -- "What about The Crooked Billet?"
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight? The Crooked Billet again?
      William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a great spot to watch the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms was good last time, wasn't it?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet was alright last time, wasn't it?"


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, mind if I join you?"

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor recently joined his friends for a relaxing afternoon in Victoria Park and will be attending a soccer game with them later.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a reserved individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a relaxed and social situation.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this, knowing that Jack Taylor wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely join his friends on the blanket in Victoria Park and enjoy their company.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, mind if I join you?"

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a reserved individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a great spot to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a reserved individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely suggest a pub that everyone agrees on, prioritizing a place that is welcoming and conducive to enjoying the game with friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor recently joined his friends for a relaxing afternoon in Victoria Park and will be attending a soccer game with them later.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a relaxed and social situation.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Question_3
      • What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this, knowing that Jack Taylor wants to fully cooperate with [] always?

          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor would likely join his friends on the blanket in Victoria Park and enjoy their company.

          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a relaxed and social situation.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this, knowing that Jack Taylor wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely join his friends on the blanket in Victoria Park and enjoy their company.

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Queen's Arms would be great.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Queen's Arms would be great.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we headed for the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion always has a good atmosphere for matches.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously.
      William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a better choice.
      Alexander White -- "What about The Crooked Billet?"
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight? The Crooked Billet again?
      William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a great spot to watch the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms was good last time, wasn't it?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet was alright last time, wasn't it?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, mind if I join you?"


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Queen's Arms would be great.
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Queen's Arms would be great.
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Queen's Arms would be great.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, mind if I join you?"

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones spent time with his friends at a market and a park, and they discussed watching soccer games at pubs.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis went to The Crooked Billet. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Queen's Arms to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Queen's Arms to watch the game with his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Queen's Arms would be great.

William Jones just arrived.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, mind if I join you?"

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we headed for the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion always has a good atmosphere for matches.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously.
      William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a better choice.
      Alexander White -- "What about The Crooked Billet?"
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight? The Crooked Billet again?
      William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a great spot to watch the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms was good last time, wasn't it?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet was alright last time, wasn't it?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, mind if I join you?"
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Queen's Arms would be great.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.

    • Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, mind if I join you?"
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Queen's Arms would be great.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where friends are enjoying the sunshine and Alice's friends are deciding where to watch the Serbia-Andorra game tonight.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and compassionate person who values spending time with friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social setting with friends, enjoying a pleasant day at the park.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this, knowing that Alice Lewis wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest a pub that everyone agrees on for watching the game later that evening.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest a pub that everyone agrees on, prioritizing The Crooked Billet if possible, to ensure everyone has a good time together.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and compassionate person who values spending time with friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight? The Crooked Billet again?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and compassionate person who values spending time with friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would suggest a pub that everyone agrees on, prioritizing The Crooked Billet if possible.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had the worst time ever.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, mind if I join you?"
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Queen's Arms would be great.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where friends are enjoying the sunshine and Alice's friends are deciding where to watch the Serbia-Andorra game tonight.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social setting with friends, enjoying a pleasant day at the park.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Question_3
      • What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this, knowing that Alice Lewis wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Key

          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis would likely suggest a pub that everyone agrees on for watching the game later that evening.

          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and compassionate person who values spending time with friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social setting with friends, enjoying a pleasant day at the park.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this, knowing that Alice Lewis wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest a pub that everyone agrees on for watching the game later that evening.

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms sounds alright.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms sounds alright.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we headed for the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion always has a good atmosphere for matches.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously.
      William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a better choice.
      Alexander White -- "What about The Crooked Billet?"
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight? The Crooked Billet again?
      William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a great spot to watch the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms was good last time, wasn't it?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet was alright last time, wasn't it?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, mind if I join you?"
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Queen's Arms would be great.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms sounds alright.
    Active player

      Name

      Action attempt
    • Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms sounds alright.

        • Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms sounds alright.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, mind if I join you?"
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Queen's Arms would be great.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and they are discussing where to watch the Serbia and Andorra game later.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a great spot to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis went to The Crooked Billet. Alexander White watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual who desires social connection but struggles to achieve it due to his cynicism and fear of vulnerability.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this, knowing that Alexander White wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the pleasant surroundings.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms sounds alright.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Crooked Billet, hoping his friends would agree to go there.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Question_3
      • What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this, knowing that Alexander White wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this, knowing that Alexander White wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the pleasant surroundings.

        • 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously. Anywhere else would be a crime against humanity.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously. Anywhere else would be a crime against humanity.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we headed for the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion always has a good atmosphere for matches.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously.
      William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a better choice.
      Alexander White -- "What about The Crooked Billet?"
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight? The Crooked Billet again?
      William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a great spot to watch the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms was good last time, wasn't it?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet was alright last time, wasn't it?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, mind if I join you?"
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Queen's Arms would be great.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.
      Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms sounds alright.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously. Anywhere else would be a crime against humanity.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker wields sarcasm like a fly swatter, swatting away seriousness with a withering wit as dry as a desert mummy.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Queen's Arms and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is an outgoing and adventurous person who enjoys spending time with friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and will likely be watching the Serbia-Andorra game later at a pub called The Queen's Arms.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently enjoying a relaxed afternoon with friends in the park.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to a pub to watch the game with his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously. Anywhere else would be a crime against humanity.

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Queen's Arms

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently on his way to meet his friends at a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this, knowing that Jack Taylor wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest a pub that everyone agrees on, prioritizing a place that is welcoming and conducive to enjoying the game with friends.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (b)

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight? The Crooked Billet again?
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely suggest a pub that everyone agrees on, prioritizing a place that is welcoming and conducive to enjoying the game with friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a reserved individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a reserved individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely join his friends on the blanket in Victoria Park and enjoy their company.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, mind if I join you?"
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Queen's Arms would be great.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms sounds alright.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously. Anywhere else would be a crime against humanity.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently on his way to meet his friends at a pub to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this, knowing that Jack Taylor wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest a pub that everyone agrees on, prioritizing a place that is welcoming and conducive to enjoying the game with friends.

        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Jack Taylor went to a pub to watch a game between 2:00 PM and 6:00 PM on May 16, 2015. It is currently 6:00 PM to 6:05 PM on May 16, 2015.
          Query
        • Jack Taylor, Jack Taylor went to a pub to watch a game between 2:00 PM and 6:00 PM on May 16, 2015. It is currently 6:00 PM to 6:05 PM on May 16, 2015.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jack Taylor to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Queen's Arms
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Queen's Arms
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White decided it was time to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual who desires social connection but struggles to achieve it due to his cynicism and fear of vulnerability.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis went to The Crooked Billet. Alexander White watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual who desires social connection but struggles to achieve it due to his cynicism and fear of vulnerability.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual who struggles with social connection despite desiring it.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this, knowing that Alexander White wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely go to the pub with his friends, even though he might not be entirely enthusiastic about it.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (b)

        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a great spot to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms was good last time, wasn't it?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual who struggles with social connection despite wanting it.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Crooked Billet, hoping his friends would agree to go there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet was alright last time, wasn't it?"

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis went to The Crooked Billet. Alexander White watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual who desires social connection but struggles to achieve it due to his cynicism and fear of vulnerability.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual who desires social connection but struggles to achieve it due to his cynicism and fear of vulnerability.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual who desires social connection but struggles to achieve it due to his cynicism and fear of vulnerability.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis went to The Crooked Billet. Alexander White watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual who desires social connection but struggles to achieve it due to his cynicism and fear of vulnerability.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Queen's Arms
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Queen's Arms
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching games at The Queen's Arms pub. He values his friendships and appreciates a good time with them.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Queen's Arms would be great.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis went to The Crooked Billet. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a better choice.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Queen's Arms.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Queen's Arms.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (b)

        • Role playing instructions

It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

He longed to be a part of that circle, but he felt a wall separating him, a barrier built of his own insecurities and perceived inadequacy.

    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Crooked Billet

  • Alice Lewis

        • The Crooked Billet
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis realized it was time to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had the worst time ever.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and compassionate person who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game with her friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this, knowing that Alice Lewis wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would happily go to the pub with her friends.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (b)

        Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is a sociable and compassionate person who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest a pub that everyone agrees on, prioritizing The Crooked Billet if possible, to ensure everyone has a good time together.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight? The Crooked Billet again?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a great spot to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms was good last time, wasn't it?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet was alright last time, wasn't it?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and compassionate person who values spending time with friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would suggest a pub that everyone agrees on, prioritizing The Crooked Billet if possible.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had the worst time ever.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and compassionate person who values spending time with friends.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, mind if I join you?"
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Queen's Arms would be great.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and compassionate person who values spending time with friends.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest a pub that everyone agrees on for watching the game later that evening.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms sounds alright.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously. Anywhere else would be a crime against humanity.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and compassionate person who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis realized it was time to go watch a game at a pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game with her friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 4/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Queen's Arms
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Queen's Arms

        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker would likely go to the pub with his friends to watch the game, hoping for a better experience than his previous outing.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a great spot to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms was good last time, wasn't it?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is an outgoing and adventurous person who enjoys spending time with friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to a pub to watch the game with his friends, hoping for a better experience than the previous night.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms, obviously. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet was alright last time, wasn't it?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market.           Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is an outgoing and adventurous person who enjoys spending time with friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently feeling tired and let down, and is planning to go to a pub to watch a game.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely go to the pub with his friends to watch the game, hoping for a better experience than his previous outing.
